question.title: How to get all constraint names from the Timefold ConstraintProvider?
question.body:
I want to use per-request ConstraintWeightOverrides to allow users to customize the constraint weights. In order to not have to save a literal list of constraint names in the UI code, I want to add a REST endpoint that returns a list of all constraint names defined in the ConstraintProvider.

I have not found a way to do this.

How can I get the constraint names in a simple way? It seems like it would be a very common usage pattern.

Things I have tried:

  • Use ConstraintWeightOverrides.getKnownConstraintNames: this returns only the names of overridden constraints (I want the names of all constraints).
  • Various other LLM-hallucinated solutions involving the SolverFactory/SolverManager that did not exist or work.

answers.body:
There is no public API to do this in the Solver.

However, if you are using Quarkus (like our quickstarts do), you can inject an instance of ConstraintMetaModel.

Thanks to Tom Cools' suggestion, I found out how to do it. In the resource class:

        @Inject
        private ConstraintMetaModel constraintMetaModel;

        @GET
        @Path("constraints")
        @Produces(MediaType.APPLICATION_JSON)
        public Collection<String> listConstraintNames() {
                return constraintMetaModel.getConstraints().stream().map(Constraint::getConstraintRef)
                                .map(ConstraintRef::constraintName).collect(Collectors.toSet());
        }
